## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
	echo = TRUE,
	message = FALSE,
	warning = FALSE
)
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)
library(readxl)
library(RColorBrewer)
```

You can add options to executable code like this

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
#| label: Judicial 4th District
## Only consider 4th District

x <- st_zm(st_read("PPPshapefiles/general2015.shp"))

		ind = which((x$BERKOWITZ+x$KELLY)>0)		
		y = x[ind,]

		judicial_precincts <- y["geometry"]
		judicial_boundary <-  st_union(y)
		
    judicial_precincts %>% 
      ggplot(aes()) +
      geom_sf()
    
     judicial_boundary %>% 
      ggplot(aes()) +
      geom_sf()
		
```

```{r}
#| label: City of Cincinnati

### Only consider City of Cincinnati

x <- st_zm(st_read("PPPshapefiles/general2017.shp"))

    ind = which((x$BAUMAN +x$BLACKJOHNS	+x$BURCICA	+x$DAVIS	+x$DENNARD	+x$DILLINGHAM	+x$DUMAS +x$FOGGIE	+x$FRONDORF	+x$GARRY	+x$JONES	+x$LANDSMAN	+x$MANEY	+x$MANN	+x$MURRAY	+x$PASTOR	+x$PRATHER	+x$QUINLIVAN	+x$SEELBACH	+x$SITTENFELD	+x$SMITHERMAN	+x$SULLIVAN	+x$WASHINGTON	+x$YOUNG)>0)		
		y = x[ind,]

		cincy_precincts <- y["geometry"]
		cincy_boundary <-  st_union(y)
		
    cincy_precincts %>% 
      ggplot(aes()) +
      geom_sf()

      ggplot(aes()) +

```

```{r}
#| label: Cincinnati Public School District

### Only consider CPS School District

x <- st_zm(st_read("PPPshapefiles/general2017.shp"))

    ind = which((x$AMOS +x$BATES +x$BRENNER +x$COPELANDDA +x$FAVORS +x$FISHER + x$FUTEL + x$HEVIA + x$MESSER + x$MINERA + x$MOFFETT+ x$MOROSKI +x$YOUNG2)>0)		
		y = x[ind,]

		cps_precincts <- y["geometry"]
		cps_boundary <-  st_union(y)
		
    cps_precincts %>% 
      ggplot(aes()) +
      geom_sf()
    
    cps_boundary %>% 
      ggplot(aes()) +
      geom_sf()
     
			     
     
```

```{r}

### save maps to file

st_write(judicial_precincts, "judicial_precincts.shp")
st_write(judicial_boundary, "judicial_boundary.shp")
st_write(cincy_precincts, "cincy_precincts.shp")
st_write(cincy_boundary, "cincy_boundary.shp")
st_write(cps_precincts, "cps_precincts.shp")
st_write(cps_boundary, "cps_boundary.shp")
```
